title: Tracing custom ops
body_html:
I wrote a custom op using the process described here, giving me a torch.autograd.Function called MyOp.

But when I run torch.jit.trace() on a module using it, and try to save the result, I get an error RuntimeError: Couldn't export Python operator <MyOp>.

Is there a way to do this? I noticed this but I couldn't figure out how to get it to work.

Thanks!
body_text:
I wrote a custom op using the process described here, giving me a torch.autograd.Function called MyOp.
But when I run torch.jit.trace() on a module using it, and try to save the result, I get an error RuntimeError: Couldn't export Python operator <MyOp>.
Is there a way to do this? I noticed this but I couldn't figure out how to get it to work.
Thanks!
body:
I wrote a custom op using the process described [here](https://pytorch.org/tutorials/advanced/cpp_extension.html), giving me a `torch.autograd.Function` called `MyOp`.

But when I run `torch.jit.trace()` on a module using it, and try to save the result, I get an error `RuntimeError: Couldn't export Python operator <MyOp>`. 

Is there a way to do this? I noticed [this](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/_ops.py) but I couldn't figure out how to get it to work.

Thanks!
